body_html:
@flx42 OCI's image-spec and manifest allows the specification of the running platform's CPU so that for multi-arch containers, only the image that is pertinent to user's machine, is downloaded and run.

There is no GPU specifications in OCI's image-spec yet though I could see it potentially could be of interest for many people. As user certainly will only want to download and run a minimal GPU capable container image that is relevant to running machine's GPU. I can raise that issue to OCI folks to see if there is anything that could be done in the future in OCI's image-spec.

@flx42 OCI's image-spec and manifest allows the specification of the running platform's CPU so that for `multi-arch` containers, only the image that is pertinent to user's machine, is downloaded and run. 

There is no GPU specifications in OCI's image-spec yet though I could see it potentially could be of interest for many people. As user certainly will only want to download and run a minimal GPU capable container image that is relevant to running machine's GPU. I can raise that issue to OCI folks to see if there is anything that could be done in the future in OCI's image-spec.
